events.title: George Washington Resigns as Commander-in-Chief
events.description: George Washington resigns his commission as commander-in-chief of the Continental Army before the Continental Congress, signaling the end of his military duties after the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: Washington's resignation was a precedent for civilian control of the military and reinforced the democratic principles of the new nation.

events.title: First Wireless Voice Transmission Across the Atlantic
events.description: Dr. Ernst Alexanderson successfully transmits the first wireless voice message across the Atlantic Ocean, demonstrating significant advancements in long-distance radio communication.
events.significance: This breakthrough paved the way for global communication networks and revolutionized telecommunications.

events.title: Assassination of President John F. Kennedy's Killer
events.description: Lee Harvey Oswald, the assassin of U.S. President John F. Kennedy, is shot and killed by Jack Ruby during a live broadcast in Dallas, Texas.
events.significance: Oswald's death closed direct investigation avenues and fueled numerous conspiracy theories surrounding the Kennedy assassination.

events.title: UN Peacekeepers Withdraw from Somalia
events.description: The United Nations withdraws most of its peacekeeping forces from Somalia amid escalating violence and difficulties in stabilizing the region following the Somali Civil War.
events.significance: This withdrawal highlighted the challenges of international peacekeeping in failed states and influenced future UN missions.
